adverbs.description: unfortunately (comparative more unfortunately, superlative most unfortunately)

entries.meaning: Happening through bad luck, or because of some unfortunate event.
examples: The houses which burned down could have been saved. Unfortunately, the fire truck had broken down on the way.

entries.meaning: Used (as a parenthetical word) to express disappointment, compassion, sorrow, regret  or grief.
examples: Unfortunately, the uproar awoke Mr. Jones, who sprang out of bed, making sure that there was a fox in the yard.
